head.citation-title: Proceedings - 13th Latin American Robotics Symposium and 4th Brazilian Symposium on Robotics, LARS/SBR 2016
head.abstracts: The proceedings contain 58 papers. The topics discussed include: using deep learning for exploration and recognition of objects based on images; vision-based obstacle avoidance using deep learning; a semi-automated approach for recognizing moving targets using a global vision system; towards the electromechanical design of an autonomous robotic sailboat; an independent control system for testing and analysis of UAVs in indoor environments; a bio-inspired apodal and modular robot; Dimitri: a low-cost compliant humanoid torso designed for cognitive robotics research; parsimonious kinematic control of nonholonomic mobile manipulators; keyframe movement optimization for simulated humanoid robot using a parallel optimization framework; LQR and H-infinity controls of a free-floating space manipulator with two arms; whole-body modeling and hierarchical control of a humanoid robot based on dual quaternion algebra; performance requirements derivation for IEEE very small size competition; FPGA based sensor integration and communication protocols for automated robot control in linear welding; and environment identification and path planning for autonomous NDT inspection of spherical storage tanks.
